com.linkedin.cubert.io.rubix

Class RubixRecordWriter<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.RecordWriter<K,V>
      • com.linkedin.cubert.io.rubix.RubixRecordWriter<K,V>

  • public class RubixRecordWriter<K,V>
extends RecordWriter<K,V>
    Writes data in rubix binary file format. The rubix file format stores all values together in the beginning of the file, followed by all keys together at the end of the file. This RecordWriter caches all keys in memory, and dumps them to file when all record values are written. It is, therefore, expected that the cumulative size of keys does not exceed the available memory of the process.

    The data is organized in the following manner:

    File := [Value Section] [Key Section] <int = Key Section size>

    Value Section := [Value] [Value] [Value] ...

    Key Section := <string = key class> <string = value class> <BlockSchema of the file> <parition keys> <sort keys> [Key <long=offset of first value in value section> <number of records for this key>]

    Each non-null key is considered as an InputSplit. As an example, say, the client emitted the following key-values:

    • key1, value1
    • null, value2
    • null, value3
    • key2, value4

    The file will be stored as:

    value1 value2 value3 value4 key1 offset_value1 blockid1 output_record_count1 key2 offset_value4 blockid2 output_record_count2

    There are two input splits, one for each non-null key. The the first split, the mapper will receive the following pairs of key-values: (key1, value1), (null, value2), (null, value3). In the second split, the mapper will receive (key2, value4).
